title: Definition Lists
text: Definition lists allow you to create term-definition pairs, commonly used for glossaries, dictionaries, or technical documentation. In Quarto Markdown, definition lists are created using an embedded markdown DSL with divs and bullet lists.

title: Definition Lists
text: Definition lists allow you to create term-definition pairs, commonly used for glossaries, dictionaries, or technical documentation. In Quarto Markdown, definition lists are created using an embedded markdown DSL with divs and bullet lists.

title: Definition Lists
text:
Syntax
To create a definition list, use a fenced div with the .definition-list class containing a bullet list with a specific structure:
::: {.definition-list}
* Term 1
  - Definition for term 1
* Term 2
  - First definition for term 2
  - Second definition for term 2
:::

Structure Requirements
Each definition list item must follow this structure:

Top-level bullet item: Contains the term (as plain text or paragraph)
Nested bullet list: Contains one or more definitions

The term can include inline formatting like bold, emphasis, or code.

title: Definition Lists
text:
Examples

Basic Definition List


Quarto

An open-source scientific and technical publishing system

Markdown

A lightweight markup language for creating formatted text

Pandoc

A universal document converter



::: {.definition-list}
* Quarto
  - An open-source scientific and technical publishing system
* Markdown
  - A lightweight markup language for creating formatted text
* Pandoc
  - A universal document converter
:::


Multiple Definitions per Term


Set

A collection of distinct objects
In programming, an unordered collection with unique elements
In mathematics, a well-defined collection of distinct objects



::: {.definition-list}
* Set
  - A collection of distinct objects
  - In programming, an unordered collection with unique elements
  - In mathematics, a well-defined collection of distinct objects
:::


Terms with Inline Formatting


HTML

HyperText Markup Language, the standard markup language for web pages

malloc()

A C function that allocates memory dynamically

API

Application Programming Interface



::: {.definition-list}
* **HTML**
  - HyperText Markup Language, the standard markup language for web pages
* `malloc()`
  - A C function that allocates memory dynamically
* *API*
  - Application Programming Interface
:::

title: Definition Lists
text:
Invalid Syntax
The following patterns will not create a definition list and will remain as regular divs:

Missing Nested List
::: {.definition-list}
* Term without definition
* Another term
:::
This is invalid because the terms don’t have nested bullet lists for definitions.


Extra Content
::: {.definition-list}
* Term

  Extra paragraph here

  - Definition
:::
This is invalid because there’s additional content (a paragraph) between the term and the definition list.


Empty Div
::: {.definition-list}
:::
This is invalid because the div is empty.

title: Definition Lists
text:
Technical Details

AST Representation
Definition lists are converted to Pandoc’s DefinitionList AST node during post-processing. The structure is:

Each item is a tuple of (term, definitions) where:

term is a list of inline elements
definitions is a list of definition blocks (each definition is a list of blocks)




Source Location Preservation
The implementation preserves source location information from the original div, enabling accurate error reporting and source mapping.


Validation
The parser strictly validates the structure. Invalid definition list divs remain as regular divs with the .definition-list class, allowing for graceful degradation and future linting support.

title: Definition Lists
text:
Comparison with Standard Pandoc Syntax
Standard Pandoc supports definition lists with this syntax:
Term 1
: Definition 1

Term 2
: Definition 2a
: Definition 2b
Quarto Markdown currently does not support this syntax due to parsing complexity. The embedded div syntax provides an explicit, easy-to-parse alternative that’s consistent with other Quarto features like list tables.

title: Definition Lists
text:
Future Enhancements

Linter warnings for invalid definition list structures
Potential roundtrip support (writing definition lists back to the div syntax)
Additional styling options via attributes
